intro: Pilorea, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Pilorea has lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft, velvety texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
